query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 «O tu che se’ di là dal fiume sacro», 2 volgendo suo parlare a me per punta, 3 che pur per taglio m’era paruto acro,
query.error: **English:** 1 "O you who are beyond the sacred river," 2 turning his speech to me through the point, 3 which had seemed sharp to me even through the cut,
query.result: 1 "O ty ow th’eus treyly an avon sakrys," 2 ow treylya y lavar dhe'm dre y boynt, 3 hag a semlas marow oedh ev dhe'm sharp,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 ricominciò, seguendo sanza cunta, 5 «dì, dì se questo è vero: a tanta accusa 6 tua confession conviene esser congiunta».
query.error: **English:** 4 he began again, continuing without delay, 5 "say, say if this is true: to such an accusation 6 your confession must be joined."
query.result: 4 ev a dhallathas, ow sewya heb lettya, 5 "lever, lever mar yw gwir: dhe'n akussasyon 6 re dhiskwedhyans a wra dhe junya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Era la mia virtù tanto confusa, 8 che la voce si mosse, e pria si spense 9 che da li organi suoi fosse dischiusa.
query.error: **English:** 7 My virtue was so confounded, 8 that my voice moved, and died away before 9 it was released from its organs.
query.result: 7 Mar gallos oedh y'm vertyus konfusys, 8 an lav a wayas, ha marow a wayas kyns 9 ev a vydh diskwedhys a'y organow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Poco sofferse; poi disse: «Che pense? 11 Rispondi a me; ché le memorie triste 12 in te non sono ancor da l’acqua offense».
query.error: **English:** 10 He suffered a little; then he said: "What are you thinking? 11 Answer me; for the sad memories 12 are not yet erased from you by the water."
query.result: 10 Ev a dhuggas byskas; wosa henna ev a leveris: "Pyth yw owth poynt? 11 Respond dhe'm; rag an memorysow trist 12 ynnos nans yw marow diskwedhys gans an dowr."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Confusione e paura insieme miste 14 mi pinsero un tal «sì» fuor de la bocca, 15 al quale intender fuor mestier le viste.
query.error: **English:** 13 Confusion and fear, mingled together, 14 forced such a "yes" from my mouth, 15 that to understand it, sight was necessary.
query.result: 13 Konfusyon ha poan, meskys gans unn, 14 a wayas "ya" pareil a'm bewnans, 15 dhe dhe dhiskwedhes oedh mester dhe'n golwg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Come balestro frange, quando scocca 17 da troppa tesa, la sua corda e l’arco, 18 e con men foga l’asta il segno tocca,
query.error: **English:** 16 As a crossbow breaks, when it shoots 17 from being drawn too tight, its string and bow, 18 and with less force the arrow reaches its mark,
query.result: 16 Dell yw balestra pan yw skoedhys, pan yw skoedhys 17 a-rag dhe vos tesys, y kord ha'n bow, 18 ha gans le moy foga an arw a wra'n merk,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 sì scoppia’ io sottesso grave carco, 20 fuori sgorgando lagrime e sospiri, 21 e la voce allentò per lo suo varco.
query.error: **English:** 19 so I burst beneath the heavy burden, 20 pouring forth tears and sighs, 21 and my voice weakened as it passed through my throat.
query.result: 19 marow a skoedhas a-rag an karga pysk, 20 ow gorra deherow ha sisyow, 21 ha'm lav a wayas gwan dre y fordh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Ond’ ella a me: «Per entro i mie’ disiri, 23 che ti menavano ad amar lo bene 24 di là dal qual non è a che s’aspiri,
query.error: **English:** 22 Then she said to me: "Through my desires, 23 which were leading you to love the good 24 beyond which there is nothing to aspire to,
query.result: 22 Wosa henna hi a leveris dhe'm: "Dre'm dysyryow, 23 hag a'th ledyas dhe garas an da 24 treyly an pyth yw mar dhe aspyrya,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 quai fossi attraversati o quai catene 26 trovasti, per che del passare innanzi 27 dovessiti così spogliar la spene?
query.error: **English:** 25 what obstacles or what chains 26 did you find, that you had to strip yourself of hope 27 of passing onward?
query.result: 25 pyth obstaklys po pyth katenys 26 a'th kavos, rag an ke re dhisyth dhe spolya 27 owth spyr dhe passya wartha?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 E quali agevolezze o quali avanzi 29 ne la fronte de li altri si mostraro, 30 per che dovessi lor passeggiare anzi?».
query.error: **English:** 28 And what allurements or what advantages 29 did you see in the faces of the others, 30 that you should choose to follow them instead?"
query.result: 28 Ha pyth esedhysow po pyth avancys 29 yn frontys an re erel a'th diskwedhas, 30 rag an ke re dhisyth dhe passya henna kyns?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Dopo la tratta d’un sospiro amaro, 32 a pena ebbi la voce che rispuose, 33 e le labbra a fatica la formaro.
query.error: **English:** 31 After the course of a bitter sigh, 32 I scarcely had the voice that answered, 33 and my lips formed it with difficulty.
query.result: 31 Wosa'n fordh a un anaval feth, 32 a-ugh genef vy leveryow an golwas, 33 ha'm diwevrasow an fordhys gans an lagasow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Piangendo dissi: «Le presenti cose 35 col falso lor piacer volser miei passi, 36 tosto che ’l vostro viso si nascose».
query.error: **English:** 34 Weeping, I said: “The present things 35 with their false pleasure turned my steps, 36 as soon as your face was hidden.”
query.result: 34 Yn keun, me a leveris: “An traoweth ma, 35 gans aga gwrians pleser, a drovis vy pasow, 36 pub sodho pan wre dha hwel a veu kudhis.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Ed ella: «Se tacessi o se negassi 38 ciò che confessi, non fora men nota 39 la colpa tua: da tal giudice sassi!
query.error: **English:** 37 And she: “If you were silent or if you denied 38 what you confess, your fault would be no less known: 39 from such a judge you cannot hide!
query.result: 37 Ha hi: “P’an taves po p’an wravy 38 henna a wra vyth, nyns eus vyth le myn notys 39 dha feth: dhyworth an breuslyas na yllir kudhis!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Ma quando scoppia de la propria gota 41 l’accusa del peccato, in nostra corte 42 rivolge sé contra ’l taglio la rota.
query.error: **English:** 40 But when the accusation of sin bursts forth from one’s own cheek, 41 in our court it turns the wheel against the blade.
query.result: 40 Mes pan wre’n kusulyans a’th wangen honan 41 an akussans a’th pehos, yn aga lys 42 yma an rodh yn-dann an laghel.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Tuttavia, perché mo vergogna porte 44 del tuo errore, e perché altra volta, 45 udendo le serene, sie più forte,
query.error: **English:** 43 Nevertheless, so that you may bear shame 44 for your error, and so that another time, 45 hearing the sirens, you may be stronger,
query.result: 43 Hemm rag, rag karas vyth kudhis 44 rag dha gamm, ha rag aral, 45 wosa klevos an serenes, vyth moy es gallosek,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 pon giù il seme del piangere e ascolta: 47 sì udirai come in contraria parte 48 mover dovieti mia carne sepolta.
query.error: **English:** 46 lay down the seed of weeping and listen: 47 thus you will hear how in the opposite direction 48 you must move my buried flesh.
query.result: 46 gorra’n hadher a’th kewsel ha klev: 47 hemma yth klev henna yn-dann an tuella 48 yth yllir mova vyth korf marow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Mai non t’appresentò natura o arte 50 piacer, quanto le belle membra in ch’io 51 rinchiusa fui, e che so’ ’n terra sparte;
query.error: **English:** 49 Nature or art never presented to you 50 a pleasure as great as the beautiful limbs in which I 51 was enclosed, and which are now scattered on the earth;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 e se ’l sommo piacer sì ti fallio 53 per la mia morte, qual cosa mortale 54 dovea poi trarre te nel suo disio?
query.error: **English:** 52 and if the supreme pleasure failed you so 53 because of my death, what mortal thing 54 could then draw you into its desire?
query.result: 52 ha p’an wra’n pleser ughella marow dhisoeth 53 rag vy mernans, pyth tra a vythverel 54 a dheuth dhe dhrosa vyth yn aga dysyr?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Ben ti dovevi, per lo primo strale 56 de le cose fallaci, levar suso 57 di retro a me che non era più tale.
query.error: **English:** 55 You should have risen up 56 after the first arrow of deceptive things, 57 following me, who was no longer such.
query.result: 55 Mes ty a dheuth dhe leverel, rag an kynsa saeth 56 a’n traoweth gwrians, dhe leverel dhe-ves 57 wosa vy, na veu moy henna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Non ti dovea gravar le penne in giuso, 59 ad aspettar più colpo, o pargoletta 60 o altra novità con sì breve uso.
query.error: **English:** 58 It should not have weighed down your wings 59 to wait for another blow, oh young girl, 60 or another novelty with such brief experience.
query.result: 58 Nyns eus dheuth dhe bos dhe wraga dha esel dhe-ves, 59 dhe gorthyp rag moy kolp aral, o pargos vy, 60 po nowyth aral gans usadow kyns byghan.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 61 A new little bird waits for two or three [flights]; 62 but in front of the eyes of the fledglings 63 a net is spread in vain or an arrow is shot.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Quali fanciulli, vergognando, muti 65 con li occhi a terra stannosi, ascoltando 66 e sé riconoscendo e ripentuti,

query.result: 64 Kyns flogh vyghan, yn kudyn, mudh 65 gans aga golwg dhe’n nor, yma y won, klevys 66 ha aga hunros ha aga arrehans,

79 e le mie luci, ancor poco sicure, 80 vider Beatrice volta in su la fiera 81 ch’è sola una persona in due nature.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Sotto ’l suo velo e oltre la rivera 83 vincer pariemi più sé stessa antica, 84 vincer che l’altre qui, quand’ ella c’era.

query.result: 82 Y’n danow hager ha treyly an avon 83 gweles vyth ow kovsel aga henhyn, 84 kovsel aga moy es an erel, pan o vea.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Di penter sì mi punse ivi l’ortica, 86 che di tutte altre cose qual mi torse 87 più nel suo amor, più mi si fé nemica.
query.error: **English:** 85 The nettle there pricked me so to paint her, 86 that of all other things which turned me 87 most to her love, she became my greatest enemy.
query.result: 85 An nettle ma a wrug vyth dhe'n liven, 86 a-ugh an traow gwir ow tos owth an gwella, 87 moyha es ow enebes enebes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Tanta riconoscenza il cor mi morse, 89 ch’io caddi vinto; e quale allora femmi, 90 salsi colei che la cagion mi porse.
query.error: **English:** 88 Such gratitude pierced my heart, 89 that I fell, defeated; and what I became then, 90 she who gave me the cause knows.
query.result: 88 Kemmys o anaveth ow colon vyth carow, 89 ha kovfens; ha pan o vea vyth ena, 90 hi a wra vyth an acheson vyth carow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Poi, quando il cor virtù di fuor rendemmi, 92 la donna ch’io avea trovata sola 93 sopra me vidi, e dicea: «Tiemmi, tiemmi!».
query.error: **English:** 91 Then, when my heart gave me back my strength, 92 I saw the lady whom I had found alone 93 standing over me, and she was saying: “Hold me, hold me!”
query.result: 91 Wosa colon a rof vyth nerth dhe'n danow, 92 an venen vyth ow kavos yn unnik, 93 a welas vyth ow honan ha leverel: “Gwra vyth vy, gwra vyth vy!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Tratto m’avea nel fiume infin la gola, 95 e tirandosi me dietro sen giva 96 sovresso l’acqua lieve come scola.
query.error: **English:** 94 She had dragged me into the river up to my throat, 95 and pulling me behind her, she went 96 over the water, light as a shuttle.
query.result: 94 Hi a’m gorra vyth dhe'n avon bys dhe'n golon, 95 ha’n gorra vyth vy dhe'n danow hi a eas, 96 warbarth an dowr, es esa ha scola.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Quando fui presso a la beata riva, 98 ‘Asperges me’ sì dolcemente udissi, 99 che nol so rimembrar, non ch’io lo scriva.
query.error: **English:** 97 When I was near the blessed shore, 98 I heard “Asperges me” so sweetly sung, 99 that I cannot recall it, let alone write it down.
query.result: 97 Pan o vea ogas dhe'n glan vyth carow, 98 “Asperges me” a glewas vyth kemmys, 99 na’m gallos kovsel, marnas skrifsa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 La bella donna ne le braccia aprissi; 101 abbracciommi la testa e mi sommerse 102 ove convenne ch’io l’acqua inghiottissi.
query.error: **English:** 100 The beautiful lady opened her arms to me; 101 she embraced my head and plunged me under, 102 where it was necessary for me to swallow the water.
query.result: 100 An venen vyth carow a agoris y’n brassa, 101 hi a’m gorra vyth ow fenow ha’m gorra dhe'n danow, 102 le mayth ow kovsel dhe'n dowr dhe'n golon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Indi mi tolse, e bagnato m’offerse 104 dentro a la danza de le quattro belle; 105 e ciascuna del braccio mi coperse.
query.error: **English:** 103 Then she lifted me up, and drenched as I was, she presented me 104 to the dance of the four beautiful ladies; 105 and each one covered me with her arm.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 «Noi siam qui ninfe e nel ciel siamo stelle; 107 pria che Beatrice discendesse al mondo, 108 fummo ordinate a lei per sue ancelle.
query.error: **English:** 106 “We are nymphs here and in heaven we are stars; 107 before Beatrice came down to the world, 108 we were ordained to her as her handmaidens.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Merrenti a li occhi suoi; ma nel giocondo 110 lume ch’è dentro aguzzeranno i tuoi 111 le tre di là, che miran più profondo».
query.error: **English:** 109 They will lead you to her eyes; but in the joyful 110 light that is within, your eyes will be sharpened 111 by the three on the other side, who see more deeply.
query.result: 109 Hi a’th gorra dhe'n lagessa; mes y’n lowena 110 golow a-ugh, dha lagessa a wrug dha lagessa 111 an tri a-ugh an tuella, a wel dres moy downder.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Così cantando cominciaro; e poi 113 al petto del grifon seco menarmi, 114 ove Beatrice stava volta a noi.
query.error: **English:** 112 Thus singing they began; and then 113 they led me with them to the griffin's breast, 114 where Beatrice stood, turned towards us.
query.result: 112 Gensi kanas ow commensis; ha wosa 113 dhe’n brest an greifen gensi a’m gorra, 114 le mayth Bees ytho gwres dhe’n honan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Disser: «Fa che le viste non risparmi; 116 posto t’avem dinanzi a li smeraldi 117 ond’ Amor già ti trasse le sue armi».
query.error: **English:** 115 They said: "Do not spare your sight; 116 we have placed you before the emeralds 117 from which Love once drew his arrows at you".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Mille disiri più che fiamma caldi 119 strinsermi li occhi a li occhi rilucenti, 120 che pur sopra ’l grifone stavan saldi.
query.error: **English:** 118 A thousand desires, hotter than flames, 119 drew my eyes to the shining eyes, 120 which remained fixed upon the griffin.
query.result: 118 Mil disir moy es lowena tomm, 119 a dhastewas ow lagha dhe’n lagha skedhes, 120 a wra dhe’n grifon ow pos dhe’n nef.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Come in lo specchio il sol, non altrimenti 122 la doppia fiera dentro vi raggiava, 123 or con altri, or con altri reggimenti.
query.error: **English:** 121 As the sun in a mirror, and no otherwise, 122 the double beast shone within it, 123 now with one movement, now with another.
query.result: 121 Vel an howl yn an drygh, heb gwell, 122 an dhew vredhen a skedhes ynni, 123 whiles gans an eyl, whiles gans an aral.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Pensa, lettor, s’io mi maravigliava, 125 quando vedea la cosa in sé star queta, 126 e ne l’idolo suo si trasmutava.
query.error: **English:** 124 Think, reader, if I was amazed, 125 when I saw the thing standing still in itself, 126 and transforming itself into its own idol.
query.result: 124 Meur, lenner, hag owth omerwel, 125 pan weles an pyth ynni ow pos dhe’n nef, 126 ha’n y dhalath ow treylya dhe hun.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Mentre che piena di stupore e lieta 128 l’anima mia gustava di quel cibo 129 che, saziando di sé, di sé asseta,
query.error: **English:** 127 While, full of wonder and joy, 128 my soul tasted of that food 129 which, satisfying with itself, makes one thirsty for itself,
query.result: 127 Pan wra ow enef, leun a with ha lowen, 128 ow profya an boes na wra ow soweth, 129 hag owth ow sodhya, owth owth ow sythya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 sé dimostrando di più alto tribo 131 ne li atti, l’altre tre si fero avanti, 132 danzando al loro angelico caribo.
query.error: **English:** 130 showing itself to be of a higher tribe 131 in its actions, the other three came forward, 132 dancing to their angelic song.
query.result: 130 ow tyskewas ow hun dhe vos uhel, 131 yn y gwriansow, an teyr erel a dheuth war-lergh, 132 ow dansya dhe’n can a’ga ael.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 «Volgi, Beatrice, volgi li occhi santi», 134 era la sua canzone, «al tuo fedele 135 che, per vederti, ha mossi passi tanti!
query.error: **English:** 133 "Turn, Beatrice, turn your holy eyes," 134 was her song, "to your faithful one 135 who, to see you, has moved so many steps!
query.result: 133 "Tro, Bees, tro dha lyga' santel," 134 o an gana gen, "dha fydhlon 135 neb, rag gweles dha, a waytas kemmys cam!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Per grazia fa noi grazia che disvele 137 a lui la bocca tua, sì che discerna 138 la seconda bellezza che tu cele».
query.error: **English:** 136 By grace do us grace that you unveil 137 your mouth to him, so that he may discern 138 the second beauty that you conceal."
query.result: 136 Dre doeth ni gras na gras dhe dhiskwedhes 137 dha genow dh'agan, henna dhe dhyskas 138 an nessa pryder a wra tus ow kelmes."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 O isplendor di viva luce etterna, 140 chi palido si fece sotto l’ombra 141 sì di Parnaso, o bevve in sua cisterna,
query.error: **English:** 139 O splendor of living light eternal, 140 who grew pale beneath the shade 141 of Parnassus, or drank at its cistern,
query.result: 139 O splannder a wydh byw ha bos, 140 neb a dhyskias dan an keudh 141 a Barnas, po a yvas yn y dhorn,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 che non paresse aver la mente ingombra, 143 tentando a render te qual tu paresti 144 là dove armonizzando il ciel t’adombra,
query.error: **English:** 142 that you do not seem to have your mind encumbered, 143 trying to make yourself appear as you seem 144 there where the heavens overshadow you in harmony,
query.result: 142 na wra parres dhe dhyspyth dhe’th bowes, 143 ow provia dhe’th gorra gensi a’th parres 144 le mayth an nef ow armonya dhe’th wra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 quando ne l’aere aperto ti solvesti?
query.error: **English:** 145 when in the open air you unveiled yourself?
query.result: 145 pan yn an ebron dy dhiskwedhes?
